definition: by contrast/but as for this.../viewed from another angle/subjectively/introspection
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

sentences.english: In comparison, the path of my son's education is really smooth, which is the actual benefit he receives from the cultivation.
sentences.chinese: 反观儿子的求学路，很是顺利，修行的利益真实不虚。

sentences.english: For the full year, it was down 14 percent to $11.2 billion.
sentences.chinese: 反观全年，此项业务下跌14%，跌至112亿美元。

sentences.english: The United States, in contrast, controls its own currency.
sentences.chinese: 反观美国，它自己管理自己的货币。

sentences.english: The women at the tech company were post-feminists.
sentences.chinese: 而反观科技公司中的女性，她们却都是后女权主义者。

sentences.english: One must first engage in self-scrutiny to earn the trust of others.
sentences.chinese: 反观自己，就是要做得让人相信。

definition: and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
from this, it can be seen that...
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
